data.title: Family History County Antrim, Aontroim County Antrim 1
data.text:
Smith/McFarland

I am looking for my ggg grandparents, Thomas Smith and Sarah McFarland. They had a child (my gg grandma) Margaret Agnes Smith in or around 1849, and then came to America around 1850. Information in my family tree says that Margaret was born in Atrim, but I can find no documentation supporting anything more specific than that she was born in Ireland. Any help would be appreciated! Jane Hoy/William Bell

I am looking for the parents of my great grandparents, Jane Hoy and William Bell. William was born 1830/31. I believe both were from Ballymena area. They had children, Martha, 1871, Robert 1868, and others. Family moved to Scotland, where Martha married William Lochrie, (My grandparents.) Can anyone advise, please? Finding Great Grandmothers home

My Great Grandmother was Elizabeth Graham, b 1872 or 1873, I do know she migrated to America in 1888, but that is all I know I have some leads as to 2 females both Elizabeth born in February 1 in 1872 the other 1873, I was lead to believe she was born in Dublin Ireland as told to me by my mother and Aunts but they have been wrong on several of my ancestors already, but the 2 Elizabeths b.in 1872 & 1873 where born in Belfast, How can I find out and where do I look, I want the right info and to find her parents McLoughlin, McLaughlin, Antrim & Down

I am looking for information on the descendants of a McLaughlin (McLoughlin) family who were living on Tates Avenue, Belfast, Antrim, per the 1901 Census, & on the Newtownards Road, Pottinger, Co. Down per the 1911 census. They were Hugh, Eliza, Florence, Annesley, Frances & Winifred. Any information would be appreciated. Andrew Patrick Moore

Looking for information on my gg grandfather, Andrew Patrick Moore, who was probably born around 1831 in either Antrim or Armagh. He left Ireland in the 1840s, would have still been young, so probably left with his parents. He arrived in Saint John New Brunswick Canada, where he remained for the rest of his life. He married, Bridget Flynn, in Saint John in 1858 so was definitely in Canada before that. Brown family

Iam looking to find some information on the Brown Family . It is believed that John Brown was a high sheriff of this county before his death in 1801. It is believed that he had a large family of 12 children and a very good relationship with the Lyons family whom they named their daughter SARAH LYONS BROWN. Could anybody tell me where I could find details on the family please maybe some census ,addresses,anything as John was my 4xs great grandfather and sounds a very intriguing man of his day Gilchrist

William Gilchrist was born 1858 County Antrim, in 1881 he married Agnes Mullen in Greenock, county of Refree Scotland, they had 7 daughters. Between 1881 & 1891 the family moved to West Ham, Essex England where they stayed until William died in 1931, Agnes died 1935. On their Wedding certificate it stated William was a widow, I haven't been able to find any other information about their lives in County Antrim Ireland. The first 5 daughters Jennie, Mary, Agnes, Maria and Margaret were born in Scotland, Elizabeth (Lizzie) was born in County Antrim Ireland and my Grandmother Annie was born in West Ham, Essex. England Looking for anyone who is connected. Regards Sylvia Waughs in or from Ireland

Looking for any information on John & jane Carson, Waugh.They had a son James.They were from Ballyeaston,I think.James is my great grandfather.James came to the U.S. during the Irish Famine around 1849.I would like to know if there is any living relatives still in Ireland.I would love to be in contact with you thru letters and emails. Davidson/Murray

My grandfather William John Davidson born 1890 Seaford Street Belfast. In 1901 I believe he is living at 18 Henderson Avenue Clifton Ward with Mary A Murray and is listed on Census return as William Murray adopted son. He joined the Irish Guards in 1908 as William John Davidson . On 1911 census he is living at 40 Henderson Avenue with Mary Ann Murray and is recorded as William John Davidson nephew Ex soldier Irish Guards. I believe he married before joining the army to serve in 1st World war and never returned to Ireland.does anyone know if this is correct? william graham of belfast

Can anyone help me find info on William Graham who was a sculpter {stonemason} born about 1803 , he had a son also William Graham who was in the family business (also a sculpter} The son married an Elizabeth Semple in 1861 in Shankhill, county antrim, and had 3 children, Thomas Semple Graham(1866),Eizabeth, and Stafford.(1870) Please if you have any info, however small please reply, Thanks David hays born 1808 moved to USA

Hi, My gggfather is from Ireland and I want to find any of his relatives. I think his father was named John. They moved to the USA. But I don't have a time line to follow. I have traced them first to South Carolina where he married his first wife Margaret Walker. He then moved to Tennessee and then moved to Mississippi and married his second wife named Mary F Ross. They had several children between the 2 wives. He settled in Mississippi and that is where he died. Please please Help. I want to know who and where he and I came from. Thanks, Barbara David's birth date is 1808 or 1809 Ballylinny, Antrim

Trying to find information about ancestor who was born in County Antrim - possibly a village called Ballylinny. He was called Samuel Templeton and was born c. 1852. He left Ireland and in 1877 arrived in Staffordshire and joined the police. He had at least one sister. Any hints or suggestions appreciated Samuel Harper 1715b -1760d

I am searching for any family history or connection to Samuel Harper born 1715 in County Antrim, Ulster, he migrated here to the USA sometime between 1729 and 1735, He died in Straban Township, Adams County, Pennsylvania Sept 15 1760. I am searching for his parents names, his wife Jane's maiden name, and possible ship's name he may have sailed on. Faris/Faries/Farris

Looking for any info on Edward T Faris(also possible Robert Edward T Faries) from Antrim Ireland (wife unknown) had sons by the name of Moses (died July 11,1812) John W. (died after 1837) and Samuel W. (died april 3,1844). Migrated from Ireland late 1700's to early 1800's to USA via Charleston, South Carolina and settled in York County, South Carolina (Clover, SC and Bethany, SC) Jeffers in Belfast

We know that our great grandfather, David George Jeffers (b1876) lived in Belfast before 1903 because we have a certificate that he was a Freemason in Belfast. His parents were Matthew (b1844) and Elizabeth (Eliza) Bevin (b1848) of Northern Ireland and they had Elizabeth, David George, Ellen, and Matthew, that we know of. He was married to Elizabeth Julia Magowan (b1878) of Newtownards. Any information on the ancestors and/or siblings of David George Jeffers would be most appreciated. McGonnell Family.

I am researching the McGonnell family. Alexander McGonnell b. 1796 in Antrim became a coastguard and moved to Kent. He maried a Mary Richardson who was possibly from the same part of Ireland. Alexander's father was a John McGonnell. Alexander and Mary had three sons, Nicholas, John and Alexander who all joined the Navy. If anyone has any information, please let me know. MCGLADDERY(or various spellings)

Looking for information re:Samuel Milliken McGladdery born 4th April Tildarg Rashee county Antrim. Parents were Alexander and Hessie McGladdery( Hessie born Forde).. The only information I have on Samuel is that he settled in Pietermaritzburg South Africa and died there in 1964. Any information re this family would be greatly appreciated. He had a brother or cousinn Robert who had a daughhter Joan . Joan married a Stroebel. Any information on this family would be greatly appreciated. Pyper McCord

I am looking for details of John Pyper Born in 1876 probobly in Antrim but ,location unknown. he was head teacher in Glenavy school up to 1936.Was active in the methodist church. He married Dinah Bunting- McCord in 1905 location unknown but in Antrim. He is thought to have been a teacher in Ballinderry. If I can find a place opf birth I can get a birth certificate. Also looking for any additional information on the Bunting Mccord family of Lougherlish. parents wee George McCord and Elina Bunting. Connestions with Aghalee Ballindery Miller & Fleming families

Alexander Getty Miller b.1865 Antrim son of William Miller and Sarah Duncan. He married Rachel Fleming b.1866 Antrim dau of Malcolm Fleming and Jane Crawford. Both Alexander and Rachel died within a short period of each other sometime between 1910 -1911 in Antrim. They are my great grandparents. If anyone knows of these people I would be most grateful for a contact. Smyth Templeton

Looking for relatives of or information on John Patrick Smyth a clerk in Belfast Ireland during 1914 lived at No.4 Vulcan Street in Belfast with wife Margaret Smyth nee: Templeton. They had a son born August 21, 1914 named John Brian (aka Jack or Jackie)and other children named Patrick, Brendan, and a sister. They emigrated to Montreal,Quebec Canada between 1918 - 1925. Margaret Smyth emigrated with the children first her husband John Patrick stayed to fight in WW-1 and then emigrated later. Please e-mail me with any information you may have. All information no matter how small is valuable and appreciated. The Houstons

Need info on the family of John Houston b.abt.1690 Ireland; migrated to America abt.1735; said to have had brothers William & Robert who may have accompanied John to U.S. Some say Father is Hugh Houston? Others say John or Robert? John married Margaret Cunningham and/or Margaret McClung. Was Grandfather of U.S. General Sam Houston. The John Houston I seek may be related to this family, b. abt 1742 and married to Alice "Else" Armstrong daughter of Robert Armstrong I and Alice Calhoun of County Antrim Barron Family

Interested in any information you may have on any of these siblings, their descendants or ancestors. John Barron b.1755 emigrated to America 1785 Robert Barron b. abt 1758 married Sarah Gibson, remained in Ireland. Mary Barron b. ab 1760 married Robert Patterson, remained in Ireland. David Barron b. ab 1767 emigrated to America Other siblings may include Jane and William All lived in the Templepatrick area at one time. ANY RELATIVES OF FRED JUDE, PORTADOWN

My mother was Annie Jude b 02/07/1941 - 5 Ballyoran Rd, Portadown, County Antrim, Belfast. Her siblings: Elizabeth b circa 1933 & Frederick Jnr. b circa 1939. Her parents: Frederick Snr. b 06/12/1896 (Ireland?) & Anne Richardson Mellon b 14/11/1900 (Newcastle-upon-Tyne) married in Ireland 26/08/1931 @ Falls Rd. Methodist Church. Fred - senior died in a Railway accident in Belfast 05/05/1948. Can you make a connection as I have hit a brick wall. My mother Annie died suddenly in Perth, Scotland 24/12/1984 aged 43yrs when I was only 23yrs and had no interest in my roots. I hope this "rattles a few bones." Regards, Anne Rainey Family

I am currently researching my family history, if anyone could give me information about the Rainey family in Ahoghill, it would be greatly appreciated. I would be interested in information regarding Anthony, William, Jack, Jim, Alexander, Lizzie, Rose and Jeannie Rainey. Many Thanks Campbell and Mussen in Magheragall and Glenavy

My gt gt grandfather was William Mussen Campbell, born in 1810 in Magheragall, co. Antrim. His father was James Campbell. Mussen was widely used as a middle name in the family thereafter, but I haven't been able to find out where the name came from. I suspect that there may have been a marriage between a Mr. Campbell and a Miss Mussen at some point. Therefore if you know anything about Mussens and Campbells in Co. Antrim that might shed light on this, I'd really like to hear from you! Thanks - Rowan Samuel & David Hill

I am looking for information about my great-grandfather, David Hill who I believe came from the Lisburn area of county Antrim born around 1860. I think he had a brother called Samuel who possibly went on to run a pub in Belfast. David was a sailor who eventually settled in Liverpool. Any information gratefully received. Mccaw Family From Portglenone

William John McCaw, son of George, married Elizabeth Mulholland April 21 1851 Magherafelt. Her father was Henry. Known family were Nancy (Annie) born about 1857,Portglenone; John about 1865; Ellen born Sepember 23 1865, William born about 1879 married a Martha; Vernor born about 1880 married Lizzie (Lily) Hyndman. The Nancy at 20yrs old emmigrated to New Zealand in 1877 and married a Lurgan,Belfast man William Robert Waite in 1878. I wish to find as many connections as possible about these families to share research.
